availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John G. Eve (Knox County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier)

body.p: Knox County, Kentucky, attorney and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Eve and Frances Eve. Attended Western Military Institute in Nicholas County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Knox County in 1860. Served in the 49th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel and colonel from October 7, 1863, to December 26, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Nicholas County, District 2, p. 445A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Knox County, Barbourville, p. 28.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 448.
Find A Grave, "John G. Eve (1833-1882)," Memorial #99320503, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial99320503 (accessed June 23, 2020).
